title: Jewish Social Club Celebrates 100 Years of Camaraderie and Service
message:
A local Jewish social club, the Amity Club, is celebrating its 100th anniversary and reflecting on the friendship, Jewish connection, philanthropy and fun that’s been at the organization’s core and is now more important than ever with the global rise in antisemitism.
The club began in 1924 when a group of Jewish professionals came together to play cards at a time when Jews weren’t allowed in many social organizations.
The group holds standard social club activities such as golf events and dinners with high-profile guest speakers, but members are also involved in the community and work to give back to the area.
